intro: Lessertia contracta, commonly known as the small-leaved arrowroot, is a tropical shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the family Marantaceae and is characterized by its slender, tuberous roots that are used as a starchy food source. The plant has dark green, oval-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and prominent veins. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and edible roots, it is cultivated in some tropical regions for both culinary and horticultural purposes.
